pageContext.claim: “Just in the stock market alone, we have increased our economic worth by $5.2 trillion dollars.  That's right since Election Day -- $5.2 trillion.  Think about that.  That's a quarter of the $20 trillion that we owe.  So we've already -- but listen to this because we've doubled -- in the last eight years of the previous administration, the debt doubled, so that in eight years our debt -- literally hundreds of years of debt -- doubled in eight years to $20 trillion.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump makes a nonsensical connection between the growth in stock-market asset values held by private investors and the size of the U.S. national debt, which is held in U.S. Treasury securities.
